rest.sentence: 1D-structure perovskite materials have gradually attracted people's attention due to the flexibility of their crystal structures and their strong stability to environments such as water and humidity
In this work, 1D/3D mixed-dimensional perovskite materials were achieved by adding large cation tBA+
The Cs+ doped high quality perovskite films  were prepared by a two-step solution method, and the photoelectrical properties and stability of perovskite solar cells  were systematically analyzed
The photoelectric conversion efficiency  of the champion Cs+ doped 1D/3D PSCs reached 17.08%, and the stability was significantly improved compared with the control group

The PCE of unencapsulated PSCs could retain 80% of the initial value after 197 days of storage in Ar glove box, and 69.3% of the initial value after 20 days of storage at 30 °C with a relative humidity of 50–60%
The improved efficiency and stability of Cs+ doped 1D/3D PSCs are attributed to the filling of the grain boundaries by the 1D phase.
Download : Download high-res image Download : Download full-size image

The photoelectric conversion efficiency  of Perovskite solar cells  have increased from 3.5% in 2009  to today's certified value of 25.7% after the rapid development of more than ten years, including not only high performance, but also low manufacturing costs for devices
It proves the great potential of PSCs as a photovoltaic technology in the future

The high performance of PSCs is attributed to the high absorption coefficient , long carrier diffusion length  and high carrier mobility  of perovskite materials, but the lack of long-term stability limits their commercialized application.
Low-dimensional  perovskite materials have attracted extensive attention due to their beneficial to the improvement of stability
Compared with three-dimensional  perovskite materials, low-dimensional perovskite exhibits excellent moisture stability due to the existence of large cations
Two-dimensional  stacking layers, such as n-butylammonium  , phenylethylammonium  , and octylammonium   are grown on 3D perovskites to improve the stability of PSCs
However, the introduced large cations may hinder the charge injection from the perovskite layer to the electron transport layer  or hole transport layer  so that reduce PCE

In addition, kong's group  show 1D perovskite based on 2-diethylaminoethylchloride cations can art as a templates to induce perovskite structures [email protected] resulting in smoother surface texture, longer charge carrier lifetime, smaller residual tensile strain, and reduced surface defect density in perovskite films

Mai's group  reported a 1D/3D mixed structure PSC, due to the extended photoluminescence decay life and the inhibition of charge carrier recombination, the PSC showed excellent thermodynamic performance
Yang  demonstrated that PSCs based on cross-linked 1D/3D perovskite heterostructures maintained 93% of its original efficiency after 3055 h of work under light

Yu  prepared a 1D/3D mixed-dimensional perovskite, use 1D perovskite to compensate dangling bonds on grain boundaries , which retains 95.3% the original efficiency under 3072 h of continuous illumination
Chen  prepared a 1D layer on a 3D perovskite, the initial efficiency of 80% was maintained after more than 800 h of storage at 50% relative humidity.
Cesium  and formamidinium  doping affect the performance of low-dimensional perovskite cells
Some studies show that doping 5% cesium ions in BA2MA3Pb4I13 not only improves the efficiency, but also make the devices better stability under high humidity
And doping FA+ can efficiently reduce non-radiative recombination to improve the quality of perovskite film .

In this work, we introduce a suitable cation tert-butylamine ion , compared with inorganic materials and small molecular materials, tBA+ has a suitable ionic radius to enter the perovskite lattice to form 1D structure [, ]
The 1D perovskite compensates for dangling bonds and passivation at the grain boundaries defects, which improved the stability of PSCs

Then, a kind of novelty 1D/3D perovskite cell doped with Cs+ was designed, and the unsealed device still showed stability and retained 80% of the initial efficiency after 187 days of storage in an Ar glove box and 69.3% kept in the RH of 50–60%
In addition, this strategy of doping hybrid dimension can not sacrifice the photoelectric conversion efficiency, and even the champion efficiency is improved to 17.08%.
Tert-Butylammonium iodide  was synthesized by string a mixture of HI  and tert-Butylamine  at room temperature for 12 h
The solvent was rotate evaporated and the remaining solid was poured into 50 ml Chloroform and filtrated
Dissolve with ethanol and wash with ether for three times, then dried under vacuum to get a white crystalline tBAI product
Compared with the synthesis method of polymer nanoparticles , method of rotary
Organic salt tBAI was simply synthesized through rotary steam purification, and the structure was confirmed by nuclear magnetic resonance hydrogen  spectrum as shown in Fig
S1, Supporting Information
With the different tBAI content, the characteristic peaks of 1D perovskite may not be obvious on the XRD pattern
The prepared perovskite films according to the stoichiometric ratios   showed X-ray diffraction  patterns agreeing well with the characteristic

The performance and stability of 1D/3D perovskite solar cells were analyzed by adding tBAI to MA-based perovskite, and found that it can greatly improve the stability without sacrificing conversion efficiency
The reason why 1D/3D perovskite can improve the stability is adding tBAI into pristine perovskite
The tBA+ can enter the perovskite lattice passivation interface, because 1D tBAPbI3 is formed at the grain boundary and filling the grain boundary
In order to solve the pinhole problem
